result.execSummary:
The defendant Laura M. Seraphine was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court
Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to restitution. Balance to be paid as a condition of probation before any costs or fees.
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

No Contact with Victim. No Violent contact with Darin O. Maintain employment and/or school combination. Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.  Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Laura M. Seraphine

records.addlTxt: Dated today, from the Court to the Defendant, in response to letter received on March 25, 2016, requesting early release. Note: request denied.

Return of Notice of Entry of Judgment addressed to the Defendant.
Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been converted to a civil judgment.
Dated 12/21/15, from the Court to the Defendant in response to letter received on December 16, 2015.
Received today, from the Defendant to Judge Carter, requesting modification of JOC.
Dated today, from Judge Carter to the Defendant in response to request for sentence credit. Request denied.
(Orig.) ... revoking huber privileges. Signed by Judge Carter on 10/30/15.
Dated today, from the Defendant to Judge Carter, regarding sentencing.
Dated 11/03/15, from the Defendant to Judge Carter, regarding credit for time served.
Dated 10/23/15, from Jail Administrator to Judge Carter, requesting to revoke the Defendant's huber privileges.
Dated today, from the Court to the Defendant, in response to request for time served. Note: Defendant's Atty must submit documentation to support request or a stipulation from the State.
WC inmate communication form received today from the Defendnat requesting credit for time served.
WC inmate comminication form received on 10/14/15 from the Defendant to Judge Carter, requesting credit for two days.
Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Jail/HOC
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Laura M. Seraphine in court, in custody, with Attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.   Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1. State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Weathers makes statements regarding sentencing. Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

9 MONTHS HUBER 

TERM OF PROBATION:  1 YEAR

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed.
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No contact with: VICTIM
____No VIOLENt contact with:  Darin O.

RESTITUTION:  $400.00 - to victim (to be paid as a condition of probation - restitution to be paid before costs or fines)

COSTS:  $253.00 & $200.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation)
